result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Gozelski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharges. Bond applied.  Balance due within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M Gozelski not in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kryshak has filed an authorization to enter a plea for his client.

11:57 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State will file a victim impact statement 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Dismiss Domestic Abuse Assessment **No contest
Count 2 - DRI (domestic abuse assessment is dismissed)

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 with no domestic abuse assessment and Count 2 is DRI with no domestic abuse assessment.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - dismiss the domestic abuse assessment
Pay $100 fine plus costs which includes the DNA Surcharge 
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan
$350 bond to be applied to the fine/costs 

Count 2 - DRI with domestic abuse assessment to be dismissed
***Bond amended: $350 cash bond: Cash already posted: No abusive contact with Tammy Kizewski.

Defendant Joseph M Gozelski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
DEfendant states he has an attorney.

Bond amended: $350 cash bond: Cash already posted: No abusive contact with Tammy Kizewski.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph M Gozelski
Current: 5701 E Circle Dr, Apt 327, Cicero, NY 13039 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2015)
Prior: 3401 Church Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481
